{"step_by_step_thinking": "Anaphylaxis is a severe allergic reaction that occurs when the immune system overreacts to an allergen. It is mediated by the release of certain chemicals from immune cells, particularly mast cells and basophils. These chemicals include histamine, leukotrienes, and prostaglandins. 5-hydroxytryptamine, also known as serotonin, is not directly involved in the pathophysiology of anaphylaxis. Heparin is an anticoagulant and is not directly involved in the immune response. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Prostaglandin.", "answer_choice": "C"}
